channel.title: How to patch a super delay like tc d two?
channel.description: i want my axo to behave like an tc electonics d two, especially the behavior to have an precise control for how many repeats there are... the tc also has a tap rythm wich keeps the latest 8 taps in memory, and grooves the delay then in the ryhtm u tapped.......

item.title: How to patch a super delay like tc d two?
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

This is an example of a four tap delay. It can have feedback, but without feedback you get the original sound plus 3 repeats (and then silence). There are individual volume controls for the repeats and a delay time control that scales all the delay times proportionally.

EDIT: Wires in front would probably be more helpful...

Pasted image1552x749 61.9 KB

Read full topic
item.source: How to patch a super delay like tc d two?

item.title: How to patch a super delay like tc d two?
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

You don't need feedback. As I said, you use multiple delay/read objects.

Read full topic

item.title: How to patch a super delay like tc d two?
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

Hmm, well multiple delay taps aren't hard to do... Just use multiple reads from the same write. Setting those times arbitrarily from a momentary button will probably be harder. I only just got normal tap delay working.

Read full topic
